Pours a translucent amber with great adhesive foam. Aroma of fresh pale wood, subdued caramalt. Dry wood palate matches dry caramalt roast, earsmear and some pine hops? Finishes just a tad too early tastewise: full of monomanic character, but not making an immediate impression like Uerige or Schumacher.

Dark red/brownish body with a nice, long lasting tan head. Aroma is earthy, metallic. Taste is quite bitter, roasted malt notes, caramel, metal again, maybe too much metal. Watery and uselessly overcarbonated. Not the best alt I had so far
20 cl glas på bryggeripuben. Mörkbrun med stort vitt skum. Doftar karamell, gräs och örter. Desamma i smaken plus nötighet. Saknar humligheten som finns hos Schumachers alt.

Appearance: Clear nutty brown color with a fine frothy tan head that last, and gives a fine lacing.Aroma: Grainy, mild grassy and caramel malty.Palate: Medium + body. Moderate sweet and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Malty, nutty, some hoppy notes and mild grassy.Overall impression: Tasty and nice ale.Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with McTapps

Schönes, aromatisches Alt. Etwas dunkler in Farbe als z.B. Uerige oder Füchschen, eher Rotbraun. Schöne, lang anhaltende weiße Schaumkrone. Gut ausgewogene Aromen von dunklem Malz, etwas nussig. Wenig süße, aber auch nicht zu hopfig-bitter. Allerdings nicht die Geschmacksbombe, dafür aber schön balanciert.
Grundsolides Alt, dezentem Hopfengeruch mit leicht säuerlichem Anklang. Geschmack metallisch, röstig.
Draft. Nice dark amber color with white head. Caramel aroma. Light coffee tones in taste, medium malty, some hops. Dry bitter finish.

50cl bottle from Schlüssel Beershop. Clear amber with a medium white head. Medium body with ditto carbonation. Bitter with some sweet notes. Nuts, caramel, honey and herbs. A decent alt beer with a watery mouth feel and a dry hoppy finish.

On tap @ "Schlüssel Brauerei". Big white, foamy head. Pretty bad, skunky aroma, kinda stale. Taste makes up for it, in my opinion this is more or less the most balanced Alt you can get in Düsseldorf. Has hints of coffee and bread in it, which comes along with a nice malt body. Taste is mainly malty, light metal but also refreshing, course of the carbonation. Ends with a nice, hoppy and slightly fruity finish, which doesnt linger too long around, but deserves for a new "Schlüssel Alt" which the "Köbes"(waiter) will bring you without even ordering it.
25cl glass, draft at the Schlussel als brewery in Dusseldorf. Great Alt, smooth an full of flavour. People say its the best alt in the wordt and I might agree on that!

[Thanks to McTapps]. Bottle. Brown colour with a slightly off-white head, very creamy, dense with a good lasting and nice lacework. Aroma is earthy, with hints of caramel, malty, toasted notes. Flavor is slightly sweet, notes of caramel, toasted malts, candy sugar, moderate bitterness in the final with a medium duration.
Great Alt beer with fine malt aroma, a harmonious nutty taste, fine hop notes and a fine-pored, long staying white foam.

Bottle from McTapps, many thanks: Aroma is earthy, wet dog, roastiness and hops. Dark brown, light copper color with an off-white creamy head. Flavor is malty, earthy, roasty, nutty. Bitter, roasty, hoopy finish.

On tap at the source. On tap. Pours a clear amber gold with a tan head that lasts throughout the beer and laces. Aroma is mainly bread with a bit of leaves and grass backing. Flavor is consistent with the nose and has bread throughout with straw, leaves and grass underlying.

At Hausbrauerei Zum Schlüssel 27/08/13. Nice amber colour with an off-white loose sticky head. Aroma is sweet honey malt, nutty and some leather. Rich nutty malt, some metal. Medium carbonation, fine bubbles. Nice and drinkable.

from bottle. pours a clear dark brown, amber colour with a huge frothy white head. aroma of malts, grains, wood, moist foliage and some smoke. light to medium body, average carbonation, watery mouthfeel and dry aftertaste. flavours of malts and nuts with some earthy notes and a pleasent bitterness. interesting but not too inspiring alt.

Bottle from McTapps - thanks a lot, Sabine! Pours clear amber with airy but stable off-white head. Dusty aroma of hops, yeast and malt. Bitter flavour of hops, with touches of malt and a great deal of earthy, dusty notes. Bitter aftertaste. Well-balanced, good-looking and enjoyable. A very decent Altbier!
Draught at Schlussel. Brown/red color, small head. Caramel, roasted malt, hint of wort. A bit flat.

50cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear goldenbrown with off white head. 
Aroma malts, wood, grain. 
Taste caramel sweet, fresh bitter. 
Mouthfeel thin. 
Balanced beer, great stuff!
Bottle, thanks to mctapps. Dark brown colour with white head. Malt, caramel aroma. Malt taste, some bitterness. Medium body.
Dark brown, hints of red. Wort and malt nose and aroma. Some nut aroma. Earthy yeast aroma. Low carbonation, not a big fan.
Bottle from Mam and Dads holiday, Dusseldorf Germany. This is a dark brown beer with roasted and chocolate flavours, red fruity notes and a nutty slight woody finish.

Dusseldorf, May 2013. From the barrel at Schlussel, where I also had lunch in Dusseldorf. Dark brown with a thick, lacing white head. Lightly roasted malt and grains. Some flavor of nuts and malts with a dry, earthy finish. My first Alt of my 2013 trip to Germany.

On tap at the brauhaus. Pours deep brown-gold with a tan head. Aroma is of caramel, light grain, flowery hops. Taste is surprisingly malty up front, with a pronounced hop bitterness in the finish. Nice balance for the light body.

Bottle from some German couch surfers. Pours a hazy brown with tan head. Aroma is slight coffee and burnt toast. Taste is a nicely balanced roasted malt with a nice middle bitterness. Mouth feel is nice and clean and medium body.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Draft @ Schlussel. Solid amber in color with a small creamy head. Aroma of dark bread, caramel, nuts and fresh noble hops. Flavor is rich bready and caramel malt balanced with a firm hop bitterness and light fruitiness. Medium body with a smooth mouth feel. My favorite Alt in Dusseldorf, the freshness and hop character did it for me.

(tap) Hazelnut brown to copper colour, foamy beige head. Aroma of moss, toasted, slightly nutty, some caramel in the finish. Light to medium bitterness. Much lighter than Uerige, much less hops on the palate, no bitter finish, lacking aroma hops as well. Still good.

On tap at the brewpub. 
Thick creamy white head.  Clear amber pour.   A nice alt but served too cold.

Tap at Zum Schlussel, Dusseldorf, 28/04/13.
Clear chestnut brown with a decent off white/beige head.
Nose is dark toffee, cardboard, mineral notes, dark malt, sugar, nutty tones.
Taste comprises toffee fudge, brown sugars, background hops.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation.
Decent alt - one of the better ones.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: OCT 4, 2015 Draught @ the brewpub, Düsseldorf, while on holiday. Clear rusty orange brown color, medium to full sized beige head that lasts for a long time. Aroma is malts, caramel, lightly brown sugar, slightly metallic but somehow in a good way. Taste malts, caramel, brown sugar again, lightly earthy, nicely bitterness. Medium body, suitable average to medium carbonation. One of the best -if not the best- altbier Ive ever drunk. Way better from draught at the source than on bottle. -- [Original rating: 7-2-7-3-13=3.2 -- Sampled from bottle thanks to Dutchdrebus. Clear rusty orange to light brown color, virtually no head. Smell and taste malts, some herbs and spices, a hint of overripe fruits and a slight touch of bitterness towards the end. Low to medium body and carbonation.
Fles van 07, oranje bruine kleur, ruikt en smaakt zoet, caramel, bertje fruitig, beetje grassig
Bottle. Orange to copper colour with a small white head. Smells caramel, sweet, cardboard. Tastes sweet, malty, caramel, cardboard. Medium body, soft carbo.

Draught. (Rating # 1600)
Pours a clear medium gold with a white head.
Malty, elegantly hoppy aroma, caramel, citrus, light diacetyl.
Dry, medium body and bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty, balanced taste, noble hop notes, caramel, citrus peel, faintly herbal, some diacetyl. Elegant and highly drinkable. (2013-03-24)

100 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20110414.
Pours copper color with a small head. Aroma of caramel, malts, hay and some yeast. Flavor is the same with some fruity notes. Nice.
draft at brewery in Dusseldorf. copper amber pour. toasted malts, nutty notes, some dark fruitiness. medium mouthfeel. nice beer
Drank this where you are supposed to, standing at a wooden table outside in the middle of Düsseldorf. Deeper color, deeper flavor with some metal.
On tap at their brewery during a trip in 2008. Great overall experience, so Im sure that made the beer better. Dark beer, amber; aroma of malts, spicey. Very good. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Clear burnt copper body with a large/huge persistent white head. Aroma/taste: leather/wood, herbal/vegetative hops, bread crust and a touch of biscuit. Moderately bitter finish. Light bodied and light carbonation.

#35
Eine weitere Altbier-Ikone und mit Recht! Die Süffigkeit kennt keine Grenzen! Das Malz wird durch diese typische Bittere abgepuffert und steigert das Geschmackserlebnis geradezu ins Unermessliche! Ich bekenne ein Altbier-Fan zu sein.
	
Test vom 17.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 14,12,15,13,12,13 - 13,20

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2015 Draught at the brewpub. Absolutely fantastic. Has that basementy feel of a lager tapped straight from the tank. The most clean aroma profile out of the four traditional Dusseldorf altbiers, nutty, toasted, with a nutty finish. Creamy, sweetish, with a hop bitterness that provides just the right balance. Excellent malting, awesome beer that greatly benefits from the freshness it has at the place where it is created.

First rating: Bottle. Quite a fruity aroma of redcurrant and wild strawberries, as well as dried fruit, although the aroma base is made of a deep, caramelly and toasted maltiness. Some roasted and coffee notes, toffee and hops, as well as subtle hints of vanilla. Medium body, velvety carbonation. Deep malty flavour, light sweet taste continung towards a rather strong and pleasant bitterness and a dryish, nutty and hoppy finish. Excellent!

50cl Fliptop-bottle from De Bierkoning, BB date 13-09-2012, so not the freshest. Clear dark reddish amber colour, off-white head. Aroma of toasted malts, nuts, candy, caramel. Flavour is light sweet, light floral, hint of butterscotch, malty, toasted malts, light bitter nutty and light hoppy finish. Light-bodied, prickly mouthfeel. Decent alt.
Tipica altbier de dusseldorf. La cerveceria es una maravilla y la comida exquisita. En cuanto a la cerveza, entra sola, mejor que la kolsch y el toque tostado la hace una cerveza muy rica.

The ratings on this one look pretty lovely, second highest in style and all, basically opened this one at random, expecting something ok at best, you can never really tell with these Germans beforehand. This one was pretty nice, the fact that I had this one after what was either a pretty bad wine, which I do believe to be the case or as usual I cannot appreciate wine, it is called Chateau Lanscade Bordeaux 2010  might have helped. 500 ml. bottle @ home  obtained in a trade with Thirstybird. The head on this beyond incredible, incredibly thick and creamy, it just stays there and doesnt go anywhere, pure beauty, solid, creamy, very lightly off- / egg-white. Darker shad of what is clear, pure text book amber  damn man. Smell is typical, tad fake caramel malts, clear, light spice and liquorice, very malt heavy,  light fruits and nuts, both pure and tad fake. Clean heavy caramel, malts, herbal, taste, oily nuts, some cola, light metals, fruit heavy, light bitterness. Tad fine carb, easy, somewhat oily stuff. This is fine, textbook stuff.  Drank not long before expiring, BBF 26.10.2012 - today is 14.10.2012.
500 ml bottle a amber colored beer with a white head aroma malts spicy and hops flavor malts fruits citrus spicy some caramel and hops

Caramel brown colour, firm white head, good lacing. Nutty aroma, caramel, lots of malts, light floral. Sweet malty flavour, nutty notes, caramel. Bit thin body, sweet malty finish, caramel and walnuts.
(From 50cL bottle @ home. Slightly over date, warants a re-rate, but pretty nice as it is.)
Above average example of the style. Big bodied, Fruit / nut aroma, flavour of malty caramel. Toffee sweet aftertaste.

Poured from a 500ml bottle - a clear orangish brown with thick tan head. Smells of roasted malt, light citrus, a bit woody. Taste is some roasted malt balanced by the wood and slight brown sugar sweetness, some fruitiness is there as well. It finishes lightly hoppy and somewhat dry. Body is light with nice subtle carbonation - silky. This is one of the balanced Düsseldorf alts and the more I drink it the more I like it.

Tap @ Zum Schlüssel, Düsseldorf. Clear dark amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, nutty and moderate hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 270712
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2013 Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Delicious Altbier, colour of dark caramell, flavours of roasted nuts,and a very gentle bitterness. A beer Id buy soon again
0,5 l swing top bottle shared with McTapps. To date maybe the best alt of my life. Carbo how I like it, nice amber colour and fine aroma of malt, caramel, coffee and sweets. Huge.
0,5 liter fles @home. Fijn altbiertje, goed van smaak, niet te bitter, mooie kleur en mooi schuim.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2013 Mahogony dark red body with nice creamy head. Refined malty base, humous, hazelnut, and some sweet hop tones. Nice smooth body with just enough carbonation. Ligth sweet and very drinkable. Rich in flavour though. Very nice alt. (50cl bottle)
Bottle with swingtop 0,5ltr: Clear copper coloured brew with an well balanced bitter taste and hints of roasted malts.

Tap @ the brewery in Dusseldorf. Dark caramel appearance with a big, off-white head. A bit fruity, slightly woody/herbal, toasty malty nose. Toasty malty, nutty, grassy flavor with a light toffee note on the finish. Fairly sweet.

500ml bottle. Clear dark copper colour with average to huge firm frothy to creamy lacing off-white head. Slightly grainy aroma, minimally spicy, grassy hop note. Taste is dry, minimally grassy, decent but ideally supporting minimally sweet malt basis with a nuttily touch, a mineralic note. Soft palate, carbonation gives an almost creamy mouthfeel. Well balanced and integrated taste.
Sweet, very malty with some fresh grain notes. Amber with a short beige head.

Es sieht optisch schon einmal sehr schön aus, die Farbe ist Altbiertypisch und die Schaumkrone hält recht gut. Dieses Alt ist im Antrunk recht Süffig, teilweise leider etwas wässrig und der Geschmack kommt nur mittelmäßig gut rüber. Im Mittelteil ist es leckerer als im Antrunk. Der Mittelteil ist leicht säuerlich, hopfig und röstmalzig. Der Abgang ist überdurchschnittlich hopfig und weiterhin röstmalziig. Fazit: Ein gutes Alt, aber vergleichsweise mild.
	
Test vom 13.12.2008, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 12,11,12,11,-,12 - 11,68

On tap at zum Schlüssel
Dark color
Medium body and complexity
Typical of its style
Enjoyable

My 9900th Rating. Draught @ Schlussel, Dusseldorf. Pours ruby copper with a creamy white head and lacings. Fruit, caramel, grain, rye-bread, tobacco and hops. Smooth and dry. My fav. Alt in Dusseldorf. No question.

Tap @ Brewery. Poured mahogany color with a perfect white frothy head lacing. Aroma has caramel and bready notes, also light roastedness. Flavor was toffee, sweet caramelly, bready malt and gentle hops. Light bitter fiinish. Very smooth mouthfeel. Nr 1. session beer. Very fresh. Excellent

100 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Kahdet Kasvot. Rated on 14.04.2011.
Aroma is rather malty with some caramel, toffee and nuts. Flavour is very malty with nuts, some caramel. Bitterness grows in the finish. Feels British!

If ever you go to Düsseldorf, you for sure need to stop by the Hausbrauerei Zum Schlüssel and get a sip of their altbier on the tap. It is my favorite altbier, has nice colors and a taste that you cant find anywhere else in the world.

piękny ciemnobursztynowy kolor, długo utrzymująca się piana, bardzo dużo gazu. W smaku podobne do innych altów z Duesseldorfu, przyjemna gorycz, nuty słodu, karmelu, chmielu. Piję przeterminowane o 25 dni, ale i tak jest wyborne

Bottle, many thanks to pivnizub. Amber color with medium white head. Aroma of caramel, roasted malt, toasted bread. Taste, burned sugar, honey, fruity hints, toffee, bitter hops, woody notes. Long light bitter finish. Good.

On tap at zum Schlüssel.  Clear, amber body with a 1", creamy, off-white head.  Totally scoopable.  Laces like wallpaper.  Bready and melanoidin rich malt aroma with a spicy hop presence.  Malt has a lightly grainy flavor and brings some darker toast.  A little Wasa cracker.  Hops come through woodsier than in the aroma.  Medium body with moderate carbonation.  Still fairly bitter, but not quite as much as Uerige.  Lightly sticky, bitter finish.  Really good alt and super sessionable!
Tap at the brewpub, quite a nice alt beer, full of life, lots of dark grainy quailites, pretty good offering
On tap at the brewery. Dark brown with little head that retained. Very nice grassy aroma. Full body with lots of malt and grass flavours. Fantastic.

Dunkele und bräunlich-rote Farbe, die geradezu geheimnißvoll wirkt in Kombination mit der altertümlichen Bügelverschlußflasche. Malzig-röstiger Geruch. Ganz leicht sind Bitterstoffe auszumachen. 
Der Geschmack dieses Altbieres ist sehr, sehr aussagekräftig: malziger Oberton, dabei weich und blumig fließend. Kaffeeartige Aromen wechseln sich ab mit Nuancen von Bitterschokolade. Röstig-fruchtige Hintergrundstimmung. Zum Abgang hin steigert sich die angenehme Bittere und bringt dieses hervorragende Bier gekonnt zum Abschluß. 
Ein wunderbares Alt. Komplex und vielschichtig im Körper. Sogar die Flasche in ihrer Schlichtheit macht einen guten Eindruck. Sehr gut. Sehr gutes Alt.Test vom 3.7.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Pours a wooden amber with a big frothy white head.  Very well carbonated.  Aroma is wood, malt a little caramel and a hint of hop.  Taste is dry, lightly roasted malts, a little toffee and a light touch of hop to balance it out.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2011 My Bottom Line :  
Subtly toasted and caramelized malts are seduced by wooden, earthy hops in this slender and perfectly harmonious Altbier. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A veil of foam draws lots of lacing atop the deep amber. 
-The fluffy natural carbonation and overall dryness make for great drinkability. 
-This is a great example of ingredients that can blend into one another seamlessly. 
-This feels a tad drier than Ueriges own wondrous Altbier. The malt profile may not have as much depth either. Nonetheless, I have to say Schlüssel makes a world-class Alt I would love to have access to in this form.

From the wooden cask at the brewery restaurant.

As youd expect, its Schlüssel Alt is a copper-brown ale with fairly low amount of hops and some sweet malty characteristics. The beer is somewhat mild and lower in carbonation in comparison to e.g. Füchschen Alt.
Bottle 50 cl. Deep red, clear with a nice foamy head. The aroma; Malty, some nuts and mabye a strange caramel sence. The taste is nice and sweeet. Düssedorf 22.06.2011
Dark mud brown... Nutty skunk with roasted grains... Taste is really skunky this is a pass
Bronze coloured, reasonable dense head. Aroma has caramel, roasted malts, herbsand spices. Taste is slightly bitter, smootth, full bodied, some bitterness in the aftertaste, nice, somewhat dry.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2011 Schlussel is an "ok" altbier, but despite being very drinkable, there is nothing very hoppy to speak of and not really malty either,  It lacks a little something that would make you say "I want another one right now", just like the Uerige Alt is, for example. The place is beautiful though, definitly worths a stop if youre near Dusseldorf (along with all the other Altbier breweries!)
I love this stuff. If you think you know the best beer of the world, you have to taste the schluessel altbeer. the taste, the special flavor and the aroma are really great.
This one of the best Alt-beers you can get. The can taste the high quality ingredients and traditional way of brewing it.  I really recommend this beer.

Pours a dark orange-copper with a medium off-white fluffy head. Nose is very bready full of freshly baked bread and hops and grass. Taste is spicy hops backed by a solid lightly sweet malt backbone, all in perfect balance. Dry, slightly nutty finish. Body can feel a bit watery but is very creamy. Definitely the best of all original Alt beers and incredibly drinkable.

The best Alt I tasted in Dusseldorf hands down, and I feel this rating is well deserved. It sports a nice medium caramel appearance and a pillowy white foam cap. I was impressed with Schluessels malt balance and its slight hint of fruity flavour. Soft carbonation and a very pleasant finish...

This one is a bit over the best before date but was quickly proven to be good nonetheless. 500 ml, BB 22.October 2010, into tulip. A vigorous pour creates deep amber to bronze body with good clarity, topped by thick firm off-white head with excellent retention that clings to the walls and, although slowly subsides, virtually never dies. The nose is rich malt with caramel and toasty notes, peppery spiciness that probably originates from noble hops, fruity esters of plum and raisins.
Flavor starts with prominent hoppy bitterness counterbalanced by crisp, well attenuated malt. Fruity esters are virtually absent, slightly nutty finish is quite dry allowing hoppy bitterness to persist into the aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft carbonated with slight astringency.

In short: a sessional lagered ale with assertive hoppy bitterness and a good dosage of attenuated malt.
26th June 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Bottle in Dusseldorf. Dark hoppy beer. Slightly bitter fruit. Toffee undertone/

From oak barrels at the brewpub.
Oak, vanilla, peaches, pepper. Gives assocations to the best British bitters. Very quaffable.

From the barrel at the brew pub, Dusseldorf. Mid brown colour with a decent sized creamy head. Nose was quite fragrant with caramel malt and some herby hop in attendance. Flavour was sweetish with perhaps less bitterness than anticipated. Very clean, smooth and fresh with great balance, giving it big drinkability points. Hard to fault really, and wish Id had more time to get stuck into a few more of these.
On tap at Zum Schlüssel in Düsseldorf. Lightbrown colour with a lasting head. Malty aroma. Flavour of malt and light caramel turning into bitter taste.
Draft at Brauerei Zum Schlüssel in Düsseldorf.  Appearance is dark amber/brown color.  Aroma is light with caramel and honey.  Taste is sweet malty with light hop and bready finish.
Bottle. High creamy off-white lasting head. Clear dark brown body. Mild malt honey caramel aorma and flavor with a pretty good hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long sweet aftertaste.

Bottle from Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam. Pours deep copper with a big frothy tanned head. Nice rich caramel aroma, nutty malty and some hay. Taste is slightly roasted malts with a deep dark caramelly, slightly syrupy touch. Well balanced, doesnt get sweet at all. Complex and nice beer for dark evenings
Light brown colour. Well maintained head. This one has a very thin, watery texture and is a little bit on the bitter side. Lies heavy on the tongue.

Bottle shared by Plovmand, thanks. Clear amber body with a medium offwhite head. Aroma is malt, toast and caramel. Flavor is also caramel and malt. The flavor is in the mouth for a long time. Good beer.
Bottle. Clear amber body with a medium off white head. The aroma is breadish, toasted caramel and light roasted. The flavour is toasted caramel, some fruit and bread.

Draft at brauerei zum Schlüssel.
Aroma: Malty, toast, caramel
Appearance: amber, clear, long lasting off white head
Taste: medium bitterness, long lasting taste
Palate: medium body.

A very nice altbier.
Draught at MikkellerBAR. Clear dark brown - white head. Light roasted. Light berries. Grainy. Light hoppy soapy aroma. Grassy. Ok fruity notes.  Pleasant body. Nice freshness.

thanks for the botle, plovmand. 2nd. highest rated altbier!
clear amber, smooth white head.
sweet sawdusty, corny, hoppy, malty , caramelly aroma.
flavor is quite bitter, caramel, some hops, mostly bitter and dry hops,  ends also quite bitter. some sweet notes too. aftertaste is distinctly bitter  and sligthly hoppy.

Draught @ Brauerei im Dusseldorf. I was really impressed with this one. The guy behind the counter was a bit d**** but I can understand why. The place was dead inside, but slamming outside, and the weather was of legend. Had a lighter color than the other alts we tried in Dussy. Rose colored with shades of caramel and brown. Nose was roasted malts, bitters, a bit of chocolate. Warming it up opening a floral bouquet. Taste is fine roasted malts, some vanilla, fresh herbs, and some fruit qualities. Palate was very smooth with just the right bite, and ended with a grape like tanin bitterness. I really liked this one. Well I liked them all and Dusseldorf I am glad to say, is only an hours trainride away. boooya!

0.5 l fliptop bottle.
It pours a chestnut brown with a filmy remaining frothy head, the carbonation is soft.
It smells yeasty, light malty and of dried fruit.
The start is crisp and the taste is sweet, the flavours light nutty/fruity.
The aroma is mainly of yeast, then of caramell/light roasted malt and citrus hops.
It ends moderate spicy, bitter and dry with a tiny aftertaste.
Textures a bit sticky, the bodys medium.
Not the best, but for me everyway a nice Alt.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2013 Cask at the brewery. Every malty, chocolate and caramel like a borwn ale, but a very dry finish. Not hugely hoppy, but dry, with grass and some pepper. Lightly fruity. Much maltier and less hoppy than the others, but a great turn fro sweet chocolate to a dry finish. 

September 2007: Wooden cask at the brewery. Deep copper-brown color, low head with wide bubbles, lots of carbonation it seems. Caramel malt aroma, rich, slightly nutty, a tad sweet with a touch of hops. Nutty, roasted malt flavor. A bit sweet, a touch fruity. Deep, rich malt. Great balance, perfect actually. Dry, roasted malt finish. Not much for hops. Fantastic, rich, complex, and perfectly balanced. 8/3/8/4/16
bottle - clear amber brownish beer with a beige head. Aroma has a faint fruity note. Flavour is malty and has a significant bitterness on the other side. Medium carbonation.

(draught) pours a clear dark copper-amber colour with a tall creamy off-white head. understated aroma of peaches and strawberries, herbal hops and pale malts. flavour is very fruity, peaches are very dominant, with notes of wheat, caramel, lychee and piney hops. medium body with refreshingly lively carbonation and a light bitter finish.

Gravity from the wood at brew pub. Copper with a white head. Like all the local compettitors, wonderfully fresh, fruity and complex. Slightly nuttier than neighbours  alts with marginally less hops, but certainly worthy of a session.

Had it on tap at zum Schlüssel. After a 8 hour drive from copenhagen we had been looking forward to visit this place - and by the time we got there it was late and we were thirsty. We had 7 of these small Schüssel before heading for some of the other altbier-brewpubs. This one, we all agreed on, better than the others we had. The pour was off cause original directly from the barrels with the help from gravity. The bartender new his job and pour one every second. Very impressive. The beer itself was very nice and very drinkable. Dark yellow like a wheet-field before harvesting with a nice white head The aroma was fresh, mild with som citrus and straw. The palate, crispy as hell with a tickeling feeling and very little carbonation. The taste was fresh with a little malt, wood and mild spices and hops with a finish with a little sweetness like melon combined with a mild bitterness.
I guess this is the very best place to have this beer, where you can have it and drink it within minuttes of the pour - it still have the freshness and crispyness that make these beers so good. I guess that you loose alot of that in the bottled versions.

Bottled (thanks Bov!). Deep amber colour, mediumsized off-white head. Aroma is nuts, some grass, caramel malts and also quite wooden notes. Flavour is bigtime nuts, some earth, mild licorice, herbs and also some yeasty notes as well. Pleasantly balanced and very drinkable. Smooth carbonation.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2009 Courtesy of Bov. Appearance: It pours a deep copper beer with a small off white head. Decent lacework. Aroma: Chestnuts, melon, honey, raisins and hops. Earthy. Flavor and palate: Nicely balanced. Medium bodied with hints of gooseberries. Good hop profile. Pop corn in the finish. Overall impression: Very pleasant. Thanks Bov! Second sampling: Courtesy of pivnizub. Very nice. Honeyish with mocha in the finish. Good balance. Yeasty, complex. Definetely a very good beer. Thanks a lot pivnizub. Staying with the initial rating.

draught at the brewery - pours a clear copper colour with a little beige foam; correct lacing; gently earthy with notes of caramel and a touch of marzipan; good malt body and fairly bitter, clean palate; quite long caramelish finish with notes of nuts - subtle and very pleasant

bottle, pours dark amber with a medium off white head.  Carmel malt and bitter spiced hop aroma.  Sweet carmel malt with a little bit of bread and biscuit flavor in the body as well end with a strong and assertive hop bitterness that dries out the ending.  This is a top notch alt.  Very drinkable and balanced brew.  Moderate carbonation, crisp mouthfeel.  Good beer.

Dank an MoritzF!
Ein weiteres Altbier aus einer Düsseldorfer Hausbrauerei. Schönes Aussehen mit tollem Schaum. Hopfig-herb, deultiche Röstmalz- und Karamellnoten. Trockener Abgang und herber Nachgeschmack. Gut!
04/2007 BTO

At Schlussel pub in Koln.  The alt is more toffeeish, again very soft carbonation.  Deep old gold/brown, soft aroma.  Soft toffee in mouth.  Very bland hop on finish only slight sting and thats mainly cos its cold.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2010 Draught at the brewery / brewery outlet in Düsseldorf Altstadt, on December 27, 2008. Clear dark color, fluffy off-white head. Slight bit spicy taste, sweet, also watery. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness. Fruity aftertaste. Fruity and floral scent.7/4/6/3/13=3.3RerateAt Zum Schlüssel on March 12, 2010Clear dark copper to brown color, lasting fluffy tan dense head. Herbal, hoppy, butter, metallic (slight) taste. A bit spicy, rather fresh. Dry aftertaste, also herbal. Fresh herbal hoppy scent. Medium though moussy mouthfeel. Some residueal sweetenss, also here a bittersweet thought of the smaller glass servings. Its good that the beer keeps cold and fresh, also good for many tastings in one night, but you quickly come to the end of the glass wanting more.7/4/8/3/14=3.6

Bottle. The color is dark amber and the head is creamy. The aroma has notes of caramel, malt and fruit. The flavour has notes of roasted malt, caramel, fruit and a little citrus in the finish. It is incredibly well balanced and nice, I would love to try it on the brewpub some day  woow.

A Mes rate: bottle at Quinns.Rich dark copper colour with a superb off white head and excellent conditioning. This is a bloody excellent alt all round. Well within the best before date which is just what you want with a beer like this. I’m guessing it’s inside of being a month old and it really shows, it’s just gloriously fresh. Superb malt, perfectly downable, I could sink this in one. An excellent clean and perfectly balanced finish. Everything an alt should be. Very very well made indeed. Proof if I ever needed it that these types of beers should be drunk as fresh as possible. A brilliant beer.

[bottle--thanks pivnizub!]
Inviting aroma of molasses, a little toast, and plenty of German hops.  Clear, ruddy brown with a lasting beige fuzz.  Very smooth blend of crisp and biscuity malt with some toasted almonds and balancing hops contribution.  This is a delicate beer with not a lot of body, but a harmonius bend of dry-ish, crisp malt and gentle hops bitterness.  Light body, medium carboation, very clean.  Excellent quaffable brew.
It’s a MUST to check out the Schlüssel Brewery in the center of the Dusseldorf "Altstadt" (old-Town). To me the best Beer in Dusseldorf.

500 ml fliptop bottle: :finally my Trink Gut had an 8 pack of this. Just one. I snatched it up. Poured Amber brown with a thick off white head. Malty aroma with bread notes and light hops. Flavor is malty, light hops, light sweetness.  Mild bitterness in the finish. Almost reminded me of a Belgian. Very good.

It is a dark beer with a sweet aroma and finishes bitter but very enjoyable. Its a beer anyone will like because of its lightnes yet herb flavour.
Great Job!
Best Beer i ever had. Clear and sweet aroma with a kind of herb flavour. Nice aroma and colour with a good mix for everyone. Well done.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2008 On draft at the brewpub. Clear amber coloured, lasting head. Fruity and caramel malty nose. Malty and pretty bitter flavour, very smooth. Not very complex but extremely refreshing and drinkable. A beer i could drink all evening. I didnt know this beer beforehand but it definitely deserves the high rating. Very nice.
UPDATED: JUL 1, 2016 Clear deep amber with a large off white head. Roasted mslt in the aroma with notes of hops. Roasted flavor with notes of grassy hops, caramel and bread. Finished dry and bitter.

Bottled. A dark amber beer with a lazing light tan head. The aroma is sweet with primary notes of caramel and light notes of straw. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of caramel and bread, leading to a dry bitter finish.

50 cL bottle. Pours hazzlenut brown and clear with a diminished white head. Light fruity and dry malty aroma. Flavour is mild breadish and dry malty with a light acidic touch. Shows a light acidic and bitter finish with a mild spice note.

Swing cap botella. Pours a deep amber colour with a rather small off-white head. Weak malty and caramellic aroma. Rather thin mouthfeel. Weak malty and caramel flavour with some hops and bit of dark fruit.

Bottle. [thank you, Yespr]
[at Yeprs tuesday tasting]
Pours clear brown with a nice, creamy, off-white head. Fine lacing - becomes a thin film. Aroma is softly sweet, nice caramel and quite doughy. Medium carbonation. Flavour is rather sweet, a fine, light, burnt tone of caramel. A touch of dried fruit. Nice.

Bottle. [Courtesy of yespr, thanks buddy] Average fin fizzy white head that mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Nutty brown colour with a clear sparkling body. Aroma of grass, toasted malt, grain, and hint of nuts. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Light to moderate sweet and bitter flavour. Light bitter grassy finish.
Bottle. Dark golden body with an off-white head. Malty and a bit sourish aroma. Flavor is refreshing, grain and malty. Quite nice and quaffable.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2015 500ml bottle from trade with Koelschtrinker - thanks!
Rich brown, thin head. Nutty woody brown malty aroma. Taste is packed with all the raw ingredients that go into beer - full of husky graininess and malts. Soft finish. Solid brew, but more remoniscent of a good bock than an alt.
Rerate: Tap (Schlusser, Dusseldorf) (6:4:6:4:13=3.3)
Extremely grainy aroma. In the mouth, its very dry, a bit minerally. Finish packed full of grains.

Ein feinwürziges Aroma beginnt von Anfang an, den Gaumen zu beglücken. Nach einem leicht süßen Mittelteil kommt der Altbiertypische röstmalzige Geschmack zum Vorschein, der zusammen mit einem hopfigen Beiton einen guten Abgang bildet. Gutes Alt!

Schlüssel, Düsseldorf.

Head is initially large, frothy, light brown, fully lasting.
Body is clear light to medium brown.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted bread/grain, cookie, caramel), lightly hoppy (herbs), trace yeast (dough).

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery/creamy texture, lively carbonation.

Quite easily the best of the main Düsseldorf alts, and good to see the score here suggests exactly that.

Drank at the pub in Dusseldorf. I thought Schlüssel offered the best, flavorful balance -- between the hops and the malt -- of any of the Alts I tried in Dusseldorf. It works in the bitterness and those lightly toasted malts without sacrificing your attention to either. I had three glasses: one before my meal, one to wash down my fried bratwurst and potatoes, and another for good measure. Each was better than the last.
Really a fine beer. The bottle looks old but good. The beer is very bock-like, dry and strong, really delicious. A good beer.

Bottle. Malty, dark bread, a little bit roasted, light hoppy & sour, nice aroma. Very big foamy head, mostly lasting. Dark red body. Light sweet start, moderate bitter finish. Light body, dry texture, soft carbonation.
Good Alt.

Clearish straight amber coloured alt covered by an incredible tight off-white foam. It just stays there, sticky like glue, lasting, rocky. Upon the first whiff, you know youre in for a malt bomb of an alt. Hugely malty example with the deepest nutty nuances of any beer I know. Grenoble nuts with dried brown sugar galore. Gently bready to calm the game. Fresh make that Fresh again so the message comes through. Despite the generosity of its maltiness, this impressive artwork appears quite dry on the palate, partly because of its exquisite toastiness, partly because of its very smooth, yet crisp carbonation, active and a constant reminder of the beers sincere desire to refresh. Woodsy, leafy light hops make it as balanced as it gets solely by doing their job: support the malt. Toasted all the way and only lightly bitter. I believe this to be the top altbier in the world.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2014 Re-rate 6/30/14: Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Levi. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma of malt, a caramel note, a nutty note, a vegetal hint and herbal hints. Sweetish flavor with malt, a bit of caramel, toast, a nutty touch and a bitterish herbal finish.  Medium-bodied. Decent and refreshing but could be fresher. 6/3/7/3/14=3.3

Bottle from a great trade with Koelschtrinker (thanks!). Brown color with a medium beige head that disappears quite fast. Aroma of malt, toast, caramel, some nuts and hops. Flavor of sweetish malt, caramel, some fruitiness and hops. Finish is mildly bitter, and has some light roastiness notes. Nice medium to full body. A very nice Altbier. 7/3/7/4/15=3.6

Draught at the brewpub.
Clear amber coloured with a white head.
Malty aroma of hay, caramel and hops.
Malty flavour of caramel, hat and hops.
Dry hoppy finish.
Well balanced.

A lot of this was indulged from the woodat the tap in Dusseldorf- a tough choice but my second favourite alt behind Schumacher. A little more hoppy than some other alts making it very refreshing and wonderfully balanced. The Hallartau hop gives it a lovely aroma and good malt presents a biscuity backgound. Very morish.

Gravity - Goldencopper body, creamy off white head; Beautifull very balanced nose, fresh and fruity with quite a bit of noble hop aromas and pleanty of malt; Very fresh body, balanced bitter and a very little thin; Fresh bitterness in malty bitter finish, lots of fruit with dry noble hop aromas really standing out, it finishes a little short.

Tap, march 07. Beatifull shinny light copper color with a foamy, tight white head. Aroma is yeasty, some crystal malts and a bit of all bran cereal. Taste is spicy bitterness, some nuttines and toastines from the malt. Excellent. MF is medium to medium light with a mouth filling herbal esence and a nice bittersweet, lingering aftertaste. One of the best and hoppiest alts, charming!
Bottle. Dark golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, apple. Flavour is fruit, malt, apple, hop, hay. Ok alt beer.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2007 Cask at the brewpub.  Clear nut brown, rich creamy head. Intricate fruity nosem some nuts and lightly roasty malt. Medium sweet with fairly soft mouthfel and medium body. Hay-like lightly bitter finish. Well balanced and very drinkable.  Funnily enough the waiter at Zum Uerige admitted that this was his favourite beer...

Bottle. A clear, copper-colored beer with a dense, beige head. Quite fruity aroma with some caramel, hops and grass. The flavor has a nice fruityness and some notes of hay. Thin to medium body and a malty finish with some hayish notes. Ok, it is a nice beer, but overrated I think. (070216)

Draught at the brewpub. The aroma reminds me of flavour hops. Clear copper colour, OK tan head. Low bitterness. Caramelly, roasted aftertaste. The aroma hops also come out in the aftertaste as a sweetish, herbal note. Mild and pleasant. Quite drinkable and very clean.

Bottle. Clear light amber color with a large good lacing off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, toasted, light yeasty, earth. Initial flavor is ligth to moderate sweet and bitter, finish flavor is ligth to moderate sweet, moderate bitter with a average duration in a good balance. Body is ligth to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft to lively.

Schlüssel - The keyVom fass @ a small caravan-stall at the end of Marktstrasse, Düsseldorf, Germany (June 06).
Second day here, what more to do during the World Cup than, sadly, shop! Having none of that, I protested with a bevvie break, a lucky find I might add. This poured a paled, chestnut brown, bright and sparkling, sweating outside the glass in the searing heat. Some Schinken Scheiben to accompany it, I was hungry. Woody, though toffeeish, biscuity malts on the nose. A hint of cola, light roasted malt twitch and just a sprinkle of old, dried herbs on edge. The aroma failed to desist as I quaffed, always prominent, pronounced. It is smooth on the tongue, sweet and juicy, arousing the salival glands, exciting the nerve endings. Big malts in this one, woody, earthy and biscuity, clean and free of tannins. Munich malt seems in essence. Light spice mid-palate, remains sweet until it fades into musty, earthy hop heaven in the very back. Finish is floral for all of one second before it drops off sweet, bitter and slightly citric. Shows good length, doing the palate justice. Tasty no question, balanced beyond belief and lip-smacking good. Now whered the wife go!!!!

Tasting of 10 albiers. Wow, this is good. It was very different from all other alts. Very light on color, clear copper brown. I thought someone had slipped an irish or british ale to the tasting. This was very unlike every other (mostly major) brand of alts. And it was good! Tasty, flowery, fruity. Beautiful head. I was lucky to find this from a drink market in Essen. I will have another one.

At the brewpub. Deep copper color with red tones, very clear with a thick lasting head.  Very malty aroma. Rich malt flavor with slight roasty notes, solidly bitter which lingers into dry finish.  Generally light in body and highly carbonated, but strong maltiness adds creaminess and gives impression of being heavier than it is.  Rich balanced beer that gets better with each one.
Typical "Alt"-beer slight caramel taste, roasted, malty. Once you get used to the interesting flavour and dirty colour you might love it. Bright white head, quite good beer though not my favourite...

I struggled to find fault with this beer, but have to stick with the high numbers, as it was just fabulous and is from one of my favorite styles of beer. The aroma was malty, caramel, nuts, although not easy to pick up. I thought I detected a touch of bubblegum too. The appearance was beautiful, pouring as pretty as any altbier, light copper color with a nice fluffy head, and superb lacing on the way down. Flavor was tilted more to the malty side than Uerige of Fucshcen, but as with any fine alt, still with some display of the hoppy bitter balance. Touches of nuts were behind a fruitiness that was quite pleasant. Wood barrells easily detectable and very pleasant in the flavor. Mouthfeel was perfect, smooth, tilted a touch to the moderately heavy side for the style. I had to stop after 3 of these only to save some steam for the next two stops of the night, but if you hit Im Schlussel in Dusseldorf and nothing else, youve done just fine. Im glad to have finally hit this one on my fifth or six trip to the area.

At the brewpub in Dusseldorf.  Rich copper color, big pillow of head.  Almost looks like a nitro charge.

Big caramel malt flavor, light hop flavor.  No where near as bitter as Schumacher, which is across the street.  Due to the lack of bitterness this comes off a bit sweeter than the others.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2006 Swing-top.  Dark and lively copper pour, a very worn penny, almost chestnut brown.  Stable but soapy beige head.  Smells of sweet malts, gentle hops, and caramel.  A little sweeter smelling than the last Alt, Frankenheim.  Caramel and dark maltiness is more restrained, giving the Hallertauer a chance to shine.  A bit sweeter than average for style, and less bitterness than the other Alts Ive had, in stark contrast to the Schumacher.  Smooth and mild mouthfeel.  Well-hopped and a dry finish.  Absolutely delicious - thanks to MoritzF!

Draught. Clear brown-copper with a long-lasting frothy eggshell head leaving great lace. The aroma has mostly hops but also a buttery rye bread backing. Flavour is the same - caramel  and soft flavourful hop bitterness. Less assertive than Uerige but with a great flavour profile and easy drinkability. Excellent balance. 

Tried this at the brewpub on May 26, 2006.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2007 Draft/barrel
Consumed at Zum Schlüssel, Düsseldorf, June 2006 Full toast colored head on a regular caramel colored body.  Heavy, sticky lacing on the side of the glass.  Sweet maple and toast nose.  Taste is mostly sweet, some honey-apple and sap flavors.  Decent altbier, very fresh tasting.  


Photograph of Glass:
http://www.youforgotpoland.org/beer/SchlusselA
Copper in color with a dense one finger head. Sweet,bitter and hoppy aroma and flavor. Malty,sweet tangy middle.Full body,clean malt and hops with a linger bitter finish.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2006 Tap at the source . Well rounded aroma , malt and solid hop feel , and gentle soft speck of alcohol . After first sip you will understand why this is top Alt in Dusseldorf . Perfectly executed malt work with some hoppy charcter . It feels complete , full package . When in town this is a must try!
Veyr nice, but a little boring after a while, the foam is great and the aroma interesting, it says original.

Wooden cask in  Schlüssel brewpub. Aroma is a little sweeter malts than the other alts from the brewpubs, grassy hops maybe some almond and honey. Taste is juicey very similarto the aroma. Something you could and i did alot of while away. Possibly the fullest flavour of all the alts.

If and when you venture to Dusseldorf, you must visit Hausbrauerei Zum Schlussel located in the Altstadt, and enjoy some glasses of Zum Schlussel Altbier. Like all the altbiers poured at the various brewery/brewpubs this beer is poured by gravity from a wooden barrel. Zum Schlussel altbier was one of the most impressive I tasted on my trip to Dusseldorf, and rivals Zum Uerige, the bench mark example of altbier. 

Zum Schlussel altbier pours to a beautiful, bright, deep copper color with a bright white head, and a moderate amount of carbonation. The nose on this beer is very inviting with herbal/grassy hop aromas. The leads into a palate of clean, smooth, light nutty malt flavors, that give way to tangy/estery fruit flavors. Schlussel finishes with more clean malty and fruity flavors up front, then ends with a snappy herbal hop bitterness that lingers. 

Wow! This was such an enjoyable, delicious beer that was just packed with aromas and flavors of malt, hop, and fruit, and on such a fresh, clean, smooth body. I can not over state the freshness of this beer, and all the alts I tried. The character is just so amazingly bright and clean at its source, something you just dont get in the bottled versions of these beers. I really enjoyed the nice contrast of malt and fruit character in this beer, and the fruitiness of Schlussel distinguishes this beer from other examples of alt. Zum Uerige is still my personal favorite, but Zum Schlussel was a very close second. This beer is not exported to the United States, so to try this one, you will need to venture to Dusseldorf. A journey anyone who truly loves beer will be more than willing to make.

Bottled. .
Clear copper colour. Malty, almondy nose. Dry malty, ashy flavour with the good old caramel feel.

(Bottle 50 cl) Clear, light brown beer with a neat little head. Very typical Altbier appearance. Nice, full body. Malty with notes of nuts and a sharp bitterness in the finish. Well crafted brew. 040403

Bottled. Sweet herbal and caramel aroma. Amber color, beige creamy head, very nice lace. Sweet, malts, caramel, light herbal, light bitter, very soft, light dry in the finish. Refreshing and silky feeling. Lovely.

Schlussel is the German word for key, and there is a lot of artwork shaped like keys in the brewery building. The barkeeper is friendly, but does not speak English. I bought one bottle and drunk it at home.
The beer cola brown colour, with a nice off-white head and nearly no lacing. Moderate malty aroma, smoke, roasted coffee, dough, cellar, alcohol, some fruits, light caramel. It has a nice bitter-sweet taste, malty with hop notes, and a gentle malty aftertaste.
A lot better than Fuchschen and Schumacher.
directly from the wooden cask. Nice malty and hoppy nose, lingering bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel with a bitter finish. Excellent Altbier

Bottle Courtesy of dortmunder. Thanks!Weak pop from the bügel top. Very nice dense white head. Damp cellar aroma with plenty of fruit presence. Wonderful! Plenty of tropical sweet fruits in taste - almost too much. Quite UK-ale like.

Good color, red/brown. Head was bright white with medium body. A little light on flavor and a note of bitterness that didnt blend well with the beer. Like 2 different beers rather then one melded flavor.
Left a hop like film on my throat.
Nice coppercoloured beer with a white head. Sweet malts in the nose, as well as caramel. Sweet taste, again caramel, malts, lightly fruity, sweet and grainy towards the end. Enjoyable Altbier.
Excellent alt. Lovely copper color, creamy head, aromatic of malt and hops, tasty and drinkable. Wish I could find it in Iowa.

Couleur cuivrée abrité dun beau collet de mousse blanche crémeuse.  Arômes carameleux, mi-fruités, parsemés de houblon plutôt épicé rappelant un dessert de poire caramel saupoudré de cannelle.  Très douce et ronde en bouche, elle nous incite, tout comme le service traditionnel qui lapporte jusquà nous, à en boire durant de longues heures.  Dégusté à la brasserie même, Dusseldorf, voyage Europe 2005.

From wooden cask, at the bräuhausBeautiful amber color; nice creamy head. Very nice aroma of malt and hop. Good body structure, quite malty, easily drinkable, very nice hoppy notes. In the end the caramel is more evident (while getting warmer); long final (some sweetness, hoppiness and caramel). Well balanced, maybe too cold.

(swing top bottle) Clear red-amber coloured with white creamy disappearing head. Aromas of caramellish malts combined in a fine way with a strong floral fruitiness of hops. Medium bodied malty taste with a fruity but bitterdry aromatic and gentle finish. A great Altbier, personally my No. 4 of the classic ones from Düsseldorf.

Bottle: light brown colour, thick white head, quickly vanishing; malty and fruity nose, a little,little bit sourish; well balanced, well rounded;  malty, fruity flavour with a medium hoppy finish. The "lightest" of the classical brews of Duesseldorf.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2011 Rerate from tap at Schlüssel: Handsome dark amber, creamy golden cream. 
Nice roasted fruity bitter fresh. Wellmade Alt is a beautifullily balanced drink. 

Old rating: 7 4 8 4 16, Bottle.  Chestnust colour, off-white creamy lacing head.
Roasted and fruity aroma.
Minerally, burned  and roasted front, fruity notes undermeath, chocolate finish. Medium to light body, mellow mouthfeel.
I have to try this at the brewery :-)
Thanks Dortmunder!
A very nice altbier, large head, brown/copper color. Flavor is well balanced. hoppy enough, but has a nice sweet malt flavor, would be good with a meal or cheese plate, can´t wait to have again

Direct from wooden cask at the brewpub. Amber gold, good white head and gentle condition. Pleasant peppery hop and sweey caramel aromas, hop becomes dominant in the mouth although the maltiness is still present. Balances itself out in the finish with hop bitterness and sweet malt both lingering.

Draught at Zum Schlussel, Altstadt, Dusseldorf. Fantastic, clear looking beer with lovely creamy, white, long lasting head. Hoppy, malty aroma. Nicely balanced taste. Smooth and very drinkable. I think I just prefer Uerige Alt to this, but its close.

(Draught) This beer was my favorite in Germany. Looks like badly made coffee, nice floral and fruit aroma hops peeking out. Thin mouthfeel but really nice flavor with a caramel spiciness. Lightly carbonated really clean finish begging for more

(draught) Pale yellow-brown, greenish shine; unbelievably uniformly straight head, like whipped eggwhite poured over a spoon. Hoppy nose as British cask ale, noble German hops. Flat, but quite hoppy taste; flowery, but tasting rather British keg-ale like. Although there is no visible carbonation, the taste indicates oversaturated beer. Light to medium bodied, ends a bit dead. As expected, the most industrial of the 4 Hausbrauerei Altbiere. Why? Im sure they could do better.

Nice copper color, in keeping with the advice outside to "Trink was klar ist." Some hops in the aroma, which is dominated by malt character. Flavor is massive -- both in terms of the melanoidins from malt, as well as a clean hops bitterness with a bit of hops flavor. Be sure to have a few. Makes me wonder why people would waste their time on factory-made Altbiers.

Pot stopper bottle. Thick creamy head that you can almost cut with a knife. Copper color. Sweet apple and hops in the aroma. Firm hopbitter flavor with apple and some caramel. Quality altbier, must be even better at the brewery tap, but even now a great beer.

Draught at Zum Schlüssel. Light malty aroma, nutty bread, with small floral hoppiness, a bit fruity.  Some notes of cherry. Small creamy off-white lacing head over clear medium copper-brown liquid. Medium watery body and medium carbonation. Medium sweetness to start, also some acidity and bitterness. Finish is medium sweet and bitter, with a short sweet-salty and nutty after.  This altbier is sweeter and smoother than Uerige Altbier, but not as clean and crisp.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2004 From tap.Dark amber colour. Very nice, foamy, lacey head. Flowery aroma. Slight fruitiness. A flowery hoppiness. Spicy maltiness. Medium body. Bitter finish. The best Alt of Düsseldorf, for sure. Re-Rate: Bottled. Impressions are the same as above plus a certain degree of honey in the aroma and taste. It´s excellent, even from the bottle. Therefore a little up-rate.

I was on a car trip, from Berlin to Brussels.  I made a dinner stop in Düsseldorf to sample some alt at the source.  This beer was the perfect beer, in the perfect place, at the perfect time.  Of course take this with a grain of salt because perfection rarely happens with any beer, this just happened to be the right mix of factors, which will never be duplicated again.  Before this I had tasted a few renditions of Altbier in the states and thought it was a fairly tasty brew but nothing incredible about it, i.e. I did not go out of my way to purchase American made Altbier.  That first smell and taste was absolutely stunning.  It was definitely up there with one of the best beers that I have ever had.  I was definitely not expecting this taste experience.  It was malty sweet and there was a definite fruitiness brought on by a combination of the hops and malt.  The hop aroma and flavor was what really blew me away.  You could tell that this was a fresh beer.  The color was a good solid brilliantly clear red.

Bottle. Butter and rain on metal aroma which I associate with pilsner. Dry malt body with a fruit finish nicely balanced with hop bitterness and introducing soft caramel tones. This one is all about the excellent finish.

and orangish/red tainted caramel color with a nice and thick off-white head..extremely buttery aroma with maybe small notes of spicy hops, caramal, toffee, creme brule, and pudding..nice buttery, hoppy, caramelly, and doughy flavors ride along a semi-thin, slightly acidic mouthfeel
Tastes very much like a very strongly hopped English bitter which is strange for a German beer.  Nonetheless the head is very prolonged and the beer does drink reasonably well.
Golden copper colour with a generous, frothy, white head.  Earthy hop aroma, and wonderful earthy hop flavour with a nice buttery maltiness underneath.  Very nice.
Brown beer with a good white foam.  Light malty aroma and for this surprisingly bitter alt.  Like an English bitter and a pilsner, mixed.  A good alt.

this beer is so great that it even makes me welldisposed towards the ugly boring hole that is düsseldorf. powerful fresh hoppy smell like a czech beer. big fat round malty fruity (ripe rockmelon)body and a freshissimo spicy hop dryout. i could drink a lot of this stuff if it wasnt for the fact that theres so many others in the same street to try
surprisingly soft. doesnt hit you over the head with chunkousness or become sticky. dry finish but with lingering grain. dunno why the glasses are so small though

Malty, caramelly aroma – grainy too. Crystal clear amber color. Fat sweet malt taste turns spicy in the middle and a hefty bitter finish. Slight paper-like aftertaste. Wide and long taste profile. This is very un-German and almost like an American microbrew ale. Powerful for sure, and delicious.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2003 One of my first beer I had in my youth. "Ja sind wir im Wald hier, wo bleibt unser Altbier".-) Nice malty and grainy aroma with caramel. Red-dish amber no head. Bitter finish and dry. Wonderful Altbier! - Rerate now on tap: fruityness comes through - and appearance and palate getting one point more - as it is great. (was rated 3.9). By the way, the pub itself reminded me of Mc. Sorley's in New York - rude grumpy bear waiter was serving delicious food and beer - I kind of liked it when the only smile on his face was visible when we paid and left :-)
The best of the Dusseldorf Alts, IMO.  This beer is very drinkable and excellently balanced between the malt and hops.
UPDATED: MAR 22, 2014 Golden-brown. Bubbly head.  Earthy w slight fruitiness, and some quality breadcrust.  Lots if breadcrust, poppyseed, earthy notes.  Subtle, complex.
